page.title: 02MILBURY HEATH
page.content: Milbury Heath is a small community of one farm and twenty seven private and council houses. The only shop is a post office as the general store closed ten years ago.Bread and milk are delivered, all other shopping being done in Thornbury and Bristol. There is no gas. Water and electricity were installed thirty years ago. Before this the village pump and oil lamps were used. About eighty people, including four children live in the village. Four people work at Rolls Royce and three at the Garden Centre. Most villagers are retired. People need cars as there is no bus service nearer than the A38. The amenities are a public telephone, a pub and the Garden Centre. The old chapel is now used for storage. Most villagers like to live in Milbury Heath because it is quiet and peaceful.
